subject: p13896515
History: Year old man with new CS lead, evalaute for lead placement and pneumothorax.
Impression: As compared to the previous radiograph, there is a marked improvement the lung volumes have increased, reflecting improved ventilation. The signs indicative of fluid overload have overall decreased. A potentially pre-existing small left pleural effusion combined to an area of retrocardiac atelectasis has completely resolved. The size and border of the cardiac silhouette can be better determined than previously. No new opacities. Unchanged course and position of the pacemaker leads. The sternal wires are constant.
